headline: How McDonald’s Global Expansion and Menu Revamp Plans Will Impact McDonald's (MCD) Investors
summary: McDonald’s has outlined one of its biggest overhauls in years, combining an aggressive plan to open more than 8,000 new restaurants worldwide by 2027 with a 2026 U.S. rollout of globally popular items such as the Big Arch burger and Hot Honey Sauce. This push pairs physical expansion with menu innovation, AI-enabled drive-thru upgrades, and nostalgia-driven promotions like Changeables toys and special Pokémon Happy Meals to reinforce the brand’s relevance with both value-seeking and...

headline: TheStreet Pro: Equity Valuations are Pornographic, but We Offer Trading Ideas in Two Well-Loved Stocks
summary: A stock is not the same as a company. It sounds obvious, but so many people I’ve spoken to do not understand this basic fact of investing. You see, when you buy shares in a company, you are buying equity in that company. And equity is what’s left over after liabilities are paid off. The issue is knowing the value of that equity, which is subjective. Don’t agree with me? If that weren’t the case, stocks would always move higher when their earnings do. But they don’t, and I’ll discuss that shortly

You see, when you buy shares in a company, you are buying equity in that company. And equity is what’s left over after liabilities are paid off. The issue is knowing the value of that equity, which is subjective. Don’t agree with me? If that weren’t the case, stocks would always move higher when their earnings do.
